## sanitizeJson() function

"Sanitizes" an `unknown` by stringifying and then parsing it. Guarantees a valid [JsonValue](./ts-json-base.jsonvalue.md) but is not idempotent and gives no guarantees about fidelity. Fails if the supplied value cannot be stringified as Json.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function sanitizeJson(from: unknown): Result<JsonValue>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  from | unknown | The <code>unknown</code> to be sanitized. |

**Returns:**

Result&lt;[JsonValue](./ts-json-base.jsonvalue.md)<!-- -->&gt;

`Success` with a [JsonValue](./ts-json-base.jsonvalue.md) if conversion succeeds, `Failure` with details if an error occurs.
